meanings.definition: To improve or enhance the appearance of (a photograph) by altering small details.
meanings.sent1: She retouched the photo to make it look better.
meanings.sent2: The photographer retouched the image to remove blemishes.
meanings.sent3: After she retouched the picture, it looked like a work of art.
meanings.sent4: Her editing skills retouched the photo into perfection.
meanings.sent5: The retouched photo sparkled with newfound beauty.

meanings.definition: To make minor changes or improvements to (something).
meanings.sent1: He retouched the essay to correct the spelling errors.
meanings.sent2: The designer retouched the logo to make it more appealing.
meanings.sent3: The chef retouched the recipe with a secret ingredient.
meanings.sent4: His retouched plan turned out to be a success.
meanings.sent5: The retouched document was now flawless and ready for submission.

meanings.definition: To touch up or make small changes to (a painting or drawing).
meanings.sent1: The artist retouched the portrait to add more depth.
meanings.sent2: She retouched the sketch to enhance the shading.
meanings.sent3: The retouched painting now had a new perspective.
meanings.sent4: His retouched drawing captured the essence of the scene.
meanings.sent5: The retouched artwork glowed with artistic brilliance.
